00031 /*
00032  * Management of the device associated with a Quota Master Target (QMT).
00033  *
00034  * The QMT holds the cluster wide quota limits. It stores the quota settings
00035  * ({hard,soft} limit & grace time) in a global index file and is in charge
00036  * of allocating quota space to slaves while guaranteeing that the overall
00037  * limits aren't exceeded. The QMT also maintains one index per slave (in fact,
00038  * one per slave per quota type) used to track how much space is allocated
00039  * to a given slave. Now that the QMT is aware of the quota space distribution
00040  * among slaves, it can afford to rebalance efficiently quota space from one
00041  * slave to another. Slaves are asked to release quota space via glimpse
00042  * callbacks sent on DLM locks which are granted to slaves when those latters
00043  * acquire quota space.
00044  *
00045  * The QMT device is currently set up by the MDT and should probably be moved
00046  * to a separate target in the future. Meanwhile, the MDT forwards all quota
00047  * requests to the QMT via a list of request handlers (see struct qmt_handlers
00048  * in lustre_quota.h). The QMT also borrows the LDLM namespace from the MDT.
00049  *
00050  * To bring up a QMT device, the following steps must be completed:
00051  *
00052  * - call ->ldto_device_alloc to allocate the QMT device and perform basic
00053  *   initialization like connecting to the backend OSD device or setting up the
00054  *   default pools and the QMT procfs directory.
00055  *
00056  * - the MDT can then connect to the QMT instance via legacy obd_connect path.
00057  *
00058  * - once the MDT stack has been fully configured, ->ldto_prepare must be called
00059  *   to configure on-disk objects associated with this master target.
00060  *
00061  * To shutdown a QMT device, the MDT just has to disconnect from the QMT.
00062  *
00063  * The qmt_device_type structure is registered when the lquota module is
00064  * loaded and all the steps described above are automatically done when the MDT
00065  * set up the Quota Master Target via calls to class_attach/class_setup, see
00066  * mdt_quota_init() for more details.
00067  */
00068 
00069 #define DEBUG_SUBSYSTEM S_LQUOTA
00070 
00071 #include <obd_class.h>
00072 #include <lprocfs_status.h>
00073 #include <lustre_disk.h>
00074 #include "qmt_internal.h"
00075 
00076 static const struct lu_device_operations qmt_lu_ops;
00077 
00078 /*
00079  * Release quota master target and all data structure associated with this
00080  * target.
00081  * Called on MDT0 cleanup.
00082  *
00083  * \param env - is the environment passed by the caller
00084  * \param ld  - is the lu_device associated with the qmt device to be released
00085  *
00086  * \retval - NULL on success (backend OSD device is managed by the main stack),
00087  *           appropriate error on failure
00088  */
00089 static struct lu_device *qmt_device_fini(const struct lu_env *env,
00090                                          struct lu_device *ld)
00091 {
00092         struct qmt_device       *qmt = lu2qmt_dev(ld);
00093         ENTRY;
00094 
00095         LASSERT(qmt != NULL);
00096 
00097         CDEBUG(D_QUOTA, "%s: initiating QMT shutdown\n", qmt->qmt_svname);
00098         qmt->qmt_stopping = true;
00099 
00100         /* kill pool instances, if any */
00101         qmt_pool_fini(env, qmt);
00102 
00103         /* remove qmt proc entry */
00104         if (qmt->qmt_proc != NULL && !IS_ERR(qmt->qmt_proc)) {
00105                 lprocfs_remove(&qmt->qmt_proc);
00106                 qmt->qmt_proc = NULL;
00107         }
00108 
00109         /* stop rebalance thread */
00110         qmt_stop_reba_thread(qmt);
00111 
00112         /* disconnect from OSD */
00113         if (qmt->qmt_child_exp != NULL) {
00114                 obd_disconnect(qmt->qmt_child_exp);
00115                 qmt->qmt_child_exp = NULL;
00116                 qmt->qmt_child = NULL;
00117         }
00118 
00119         /* clear references to MDT namespace */
00120         ld->ld_obd->obd_namespace = NULL;
00121         qmt->qmt_ns = NULL;
00122 
00123         RETURN(NULL);
00124 }
00125 
00126 /*
00127  * Connect a quota master to the backend OSD device.
00128  *
00129  * \param env - is the environment passed by the caller
00130  * \param qmt - is the quota master target to be connected
00131  * \param cfg - is the configuration log record from which we need to extract
00132  *              the service name of the backend OSD device to connect to.
00133  *
00134  * \retval - 0 on success, appropriate error on failure
00135  */
00136 static int qmt_connect_to_osd(const struct lu_env *env, struct qmt_device *qmt,
00137                               struct lustre_cfg *cfg)
00138 {
00139         struct obd_connect_data *data = NULL;
00140         struct obd_device       *obd;
00141         struct lu_device        *ld = qmt2lu_dev(qmt);
00142         int                      rc;
00143         ENTRY;
00144 
00145         LASSERT(qmt->qmt_child_exp == NULL);
00146 
00147         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(data);
00148         if (data == NULL)
00149                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENOMEM);
00150 
00151         /* look-up OBD device associated with the backend OSD device.
00152          * The MDT is kind enough to pass the OBD name in QMT configuration */
00153         obd = class_name2obd(lustre_cfg_string(cfg, 3));
00154         if (obd == NULL) {
00155                 CERROR("%s: can't locate backend osd device: %s\n",
00156                        qmt->qmt_svname, lustre_cfg_string(cfg, 3));
00157                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENOTCONN);
00158         }
00159 
00160         data->ocd_connect_flags = OBD_CONNECT_VERSION;
00161         data->ocd_version = LUSTRE_VERSION_CODE;
00162 
00163         /* connect to OSD device */
00164         rc = obd_connect(NULL, &qmt->qmt_child_exp, obd, &obd->obd_uuid, data,
00165                          NULL);
00166         if (rc) {
00167                 CERROR("%s: cannot connect to osd dev %s (%d)\n",
00168                        qmt->qmt_svname, obd->obd_name, rc);
00169                 GOTO(out, rc);
00170         }
00171 
00172         /* initialize site (although it isn't used anywhere) and lu_device
00173          * pointer to next device */
00174         qmt->qmt_child = lu2dt_dev(qmt->qmt_child_exp->exp_obd->obd_lu_dev);
00175         ld->ld_site = qmt->qmt_child_exp->exp_obd->obd_lu_dev->ld_site;
00176         EXIT;
00177 out:
00178         if (data)
00179                 OBD_FREE_PTR(data);
00180         return rc;
00181 }
00182 
00183 /*
00184  * Initialize quota master target device. This includers connecting to
00185  * the backend OSD device, initializing the pool configuration and creating the
00186  * root procfs directory dedicated to this quota target.
00187  * The rest of the initialization is done when the stack is fully configured
00188  * (i.e. when ->ldo_start is called across the stack).
00189  *
00190  * This function is called on MDT0 setup.
00191  *
00192  * \param env - is the environment passed by the caller
00193  * \param qmt - is the quota master target to be initialized
00194  * \param ldt - is the device type structure associated with the qmt device
00195  * \param cfg - is the configuration record used to configure the qmt device
00196  *
00197  * \retval - 0 on success, appropriate error on failure
00198  */
00199 static int qmt_device_init0(const struct lu_env *env, struct qmt_device *qmt,
00200                             struct lu_device_type *ldt, struct lustre_cfg *cfg)
00201 {
00202         struct lu_device        *ld = qmt2lu_dev(qmt);
00203         struct obd_device       *obd, *mdt_obd;
00204         struct obd_type         *type;
00205         char                    *svname = lustre_cfg_string(cfg, 0);
00206         int                      rc;
00207         ENTRY;
00208 
00209         if (svname == NULL)
00210                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00211 
00212         /* record who i am, it might be useful ... */
00213         rc = strlcpy(qmt->qmt_svname, svname, sizeof(qmt->qmt_svname));
00214         if (rc >= sizeof(qmt->qmt_svname))
00215                 RETURN(-E2BIG);
00216 
00217         /* look-up the obd_device associated with the qmt */
00218         obd = class_name2obd(qmt->qmt_svname);
00219         if (obd == NULL)
00220                 RETURN(-ENOENT);
00221 
00222         /* reference each other */
00223         obd->obd_lu_dev = ld;
00224         ld->ld_obd      = obd;
00225 
00226         /* look-up the parent MDT to steal its ldlm namespace ... */
00227         mdt_obd = class_name2obd(lustre_cfg_string(cfg, 2));
00228         if (mdt_obd == NULL)
00229                 RETURN(-ENOENT);
00230 
00231         /* borrow  MDT namespace. kind of a hack until we have our own namespace
00232          * & service threads */
00233         LASSERT(mdt_obd->obd_namespace != NULL);
00234         obd->obd_namespace = mdt_obd->obd_namespace;
00235         qmt->qmt_ns = obd->obd_namespace;
00236 
00237         /* connect to backend osd device */
00238         rc = qmt_connect_to_osd(env, qmt, cfg);
00239         if (rc)
00240                 GOTO(out, rc);
00241 
00242         /* set up and start rebalance thread */
00243         thread_set_flags(&qmt->qmt_reba_thread, SVC_STOPPED);
00244         init_waitqueue_head(&qmt->qmt_reba_thread.t_ctl_waitq);
00245         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&qmt->qmt_reba_list);
00246         spin_lock_init(&qmt->qmt_reba_lock);
00247         rc = qmt_start_reba_thread(qmt);
00248         if (rc) {
00249                 CERROR("%s: failed to start rebalance thread (%d)\n",
00250                        qmt->qmt_svname, rc);
00251                 GOTO(out, rc);
00252         }
00253 
00254         /* at the moment there is no linkage between lu_type and obd_type, so
00255          * we lookup obd_type this way */
00256         type = class_search_type(LUSTRE_QMT_NAME);
00257         LASSERT(type != NULL);
00258 
00259         /* register proc directory associated with this qmt */
00260         qmt->qmt_proc = lprocfs_register(qmt->qmt_svname, type->typ_procroot,
00261                                          NULL, NULL);
00262         if (IS_ERR(qmt->qmt_proc)) {
00263                 rc = PTR_ERR(qmt->qmt_proc);
00264                 CERROR("%s: failed to create qmt proc entry (%d)\n",
00265                        qmt->qmt_svname, rc);
00266                 GOTO(out, rc);
00267         }
00268 
00269         /* initialize pool configuration */
00270         rc = qmt_pool_init(env, qmt);
00271         if (rc)
00272                 GOTO(out, rc);
00273         EXIT;
00274 out:
00275         if (rc)
00276                 qmt_device_fini(env, ld);
00277         return rc;
00278 }
00279 
00280 /*
00281  * Free quota master target device. Companion of qmt_device_alloc()
00282  *
00283  * \param env - is the environment passed by the caller
00284  * \param ld  - is the lu_device associated with the qmt dev to be freed
00285  *
00286  * \retval - NULL on success (backend OSD device is managed by the main stack),
00287  *           appropriate error on failure
00288  */
00289 static struct lu_device *qmt_device_free(const struct lu_env *env,
00290                                          struct lu_device *ld)
00291 {
00292         struct qmt_device       *qmt = lu2qmt_dev(ld);
00293         ENTRY;
00294 
00295         LASSERT(qmt != NULL);
00296 
00297         lu_device_fini(ld);
00298         OBD_FREE_PTR(qmt);
00299         RETURN(NULL);
00300 }
00301 
00302 /*
00303  * Allocate quota master target and initialize it.
00304  *
00305  * \param env - is the environment passed by the caller
00306  * \param ldt - is the device type structure associated with the qmt
00307  * \param cfg - is the configuration record used to configure the qmt
00308  *
00309  * \retval - lu_device structure associated with the qmt on success,
00310  *           appropriate error on failure
00311  */
00312 static struct lu_device *qmt_device_alloc(const struct lu_env *env,
00313                                           struct lu_device_type *ldt,
00314                                           struct lustre_cfg *cfg)
00315 {
00316         struct qmt_device       *qmt;
00317         struct lu_device        *ld;
00318         int                      rc;
00319         ENTRY;
00320 
00321         /* allocate qmt device */
00322         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(qmt);
00323         if (qmt == NULL)
00324                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM));
00325 
00326         /* configure lu/dt_device */
00327         ld = qmt2lu_dev(qmt);
00328         dt_device_init(&qmt->qmt_dt_dev, ldt);
00329         ld->ld_ops = &qmt_lu_ops;
00330 
00331         /* initialize qmt device */
00332         rc = qmt_device_init0(env, qmt, ldt, cfg);
00333         if (rc != 0) {
00334                 qmt_device_free(env, ld);
00335                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(rc));
00336         }
00337 
00338         RETURN(ld);
00339 }
00340 
00341 LU_KEY_INIT_FINI(qmt, struct qmt_thread_info);
00342 LU_TYPE_INIT_FINI(qmt, &qmt_thread_key);
00343 LU_CONTEXT_KEY_DEFINE(qmt, LCT_MD_THREAD);
00344 
00345 /*
00346  * lu device type operations associated with the master target.
00347  */
00348 static struct lu_device_type_operations qmt_device_type_ops = {
00349         .ldto_init              = qmt_type_init,
00350         .ldto_fini              = qmt_type_fini,
00351 
00352         .ldto_start             = qmt_type_start,
00353         .ldto_stop              = qmt_type_stop,
00354 
00355         .ldto_device_alloc      = qmt_device_alloc,
00356         .ldto_device_free       = qmt_device_free,
00357 
00358         .ldto_device_fini       = qmt_device_fini,
00359 };
00360 
00361 /*
00362  * lu device type structure associated with the master target.
00363  * MDT0 uses this structure to configure the qmt.
00364  */
00365 static struct lu_device_type qmt_device_type = {
00366         .ldt_tags       = LU_DEVICE_DT,
00367         .ldt_name       = LUSTRE_QMT_NAME,
00368         .ldt_ops        = &qmt_device_type_ops,
00369         .ldt_ctx_tags   = LCT_MD_THREAD,
00370 };

00372 /*
00373  * obd_connect handler used by the MDT to connect to the master target.
00374  */
00375 static int qmt_device_obd_connect(const struct lu_env *env,
00376                                   struct obd_export **exp,
00377                                   struct obd_device *obd,
00378                                   struct obd_uuid *cluuid,
00379                                   struct obd_connect_data *data,
00380                                   void *localdata)
00381 {
00382         struct lustre_handle    conn;
00383         int                     rc;
00384         ENTRY;
00385 
00386         rc = class_connect(&conn, obd, cluuid);
00387         if (rc)
00388                 RETURN(rc);
00389 
00390         *exp = class_conn2export(&conn);
00391         RETURN(0);
00392 }
00393 
00394 /*
00395  * obd_disconnect handler used by the MDT to disconnect from the master target.
00396  * We trigger cleanup on disconnect since it means that the MDT is about to
00397  * shutdown.
00398  */
00399 static int qmt_device_obd_disconnect(struct obd_export *exp)
00400 {
00401         struct obd_device       *obd = exp->exp_obd;
00402         int                      rc;
00403         ENTRY;
00404 
00405         rc = class_disconnect(exp);
00406         if (rc)
00407                 RETURN(rc);
00408 
00409         rc = class_manual_cleanup(obd);
00410         RETURN(0);
00411 }
00412 
00413 /*
00414  * obd device operations associated with the master target.
00415  */
00416 struct obd_ops qmt_obd_ops = {
00417         .o_owner        = THIS_MODULE,
00418         .o_connect      = qmt_device_obd_connect,
00419         .o_disconnect   = qmt_device_obd_disconnect,
00420 };
00421 
00422 /*
00423  * Called when the MDS is fully configured. We use it to set up local objects
00424  * associated with the quota master target.
00425  *
00426  * \param env - is the environment passed by the caller
00427  * \param parent - is the lu_device of the parent, that's to say the mdt
00428  * \param ld  - is the lu_device associated with the master target
00429  *
00430  * \retval    - 0 on success, appropriate error on failure
00431  */
00432 static int qmt_device_prepare(const struct lu_env *env,
00433                               struct lu_device *parent,
00434                               struct lu_device *ld)
00435 {
00436         struct qmt_device       *qmt = lu2qmt_dev(ld);
00437         struct dt_object        *qmt_root;
00438         int                      rc;
00439         ENTRY;
00440 
00441         /* initialize quota master root directory where all index files will be
00442          * stored */
00443         qmt_root = lquota_disk_dir_find_create(env, qmt->qmt_child, NULL,
00444                                                QMT_DIR);
00445         if (IS_ERR(qmt_root)) {
00446                 rc = PTR_ERR(qmt_root);
00447                 CERROR("%s: failed to create master quota directory (%d)\n",
00448                        qmt->qmt_svname, rc);
00449                 RETURN(rc);
00450         }
00451 
00452         /* initialize on-disk indexes associated with each pool */
00453         rc = qmt_pool_prepare(env, qmt, qmt_root);
00454 
00455         lu_object_put(env, &qmt_root->do_lu);
00456         RETURN(rc);
00457 }
00458 
00459 /*
00460  * lu device operations for the quota master target
00461  */
00462 static const struct lu_device_operations qmt_lu_ops = {
00463         .ldo_prepare            = qmt_device_prepare,
00464         .ldo_process_config     = NULL, /* to be defined for dynamic pool
00465                                          * configuration */
00466 };
00467 
00468 /* global variable initialization called when the lquota module is loaded */
00469 int qmt_glb_init(void)
00470 {
00471         int rc;
00472         ENTRY;
00473 
00474         rc = class_register_type(&qmt_obd_ops, NULL, true, NULL,
00475                                  LUSTRE_QMT_NAME, &qmt_device_type);
00476         RETURN(rc);
00477 }
00478 
00479 /* called when the lquota module is about to be unloaded */
00480 void qmt_glb_fini(void)
00481 {
00482         class_unregister_type(LUSTRE_QMT_NAME);
00483 }
